perturbation.original_text: It is expressly agreed that Endorser is acting as an independent contractor in performing his services hereunder. MusclePharm shall carry no worker's compensation insurance or any health, accident or disability insurance to cover Endorser. MusclePharm shall not pay any contributions to Social Security, unemployment insurance, federal or state withholding taxes, nor provide any other contributions or benefits that might be expected in an employer-employee relationship. Endorser shall be solely responsible and liable for reporting and paying all federal and state income or other taxes applicable to the Endorser’s compensation under this Agreement and MusclePharm will provide Lender with an IRS Form 1099 at the end of each calendar year in which compensation is paid to Lender. It is further understood and expressly agreed by Endorser that he has no right or authority to incur expenses, obligations or liabilities in the name of or binding on MusclePharm, and he shall not represent to third parties that he has any relationship (e.g., employer-employee or principal-agent) with MusclePharm other than the independent contractor arrangement set forth in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: It is expressly agreed that Endorser is acting as an independent contractor in performing his services hereunder, except where MusclePharm directs the means and manner of performance. MusclePharm shall carry no worker's compensation insurance or any health, accident or disability insurance to cover Endorser. MusclePharm shall not pay any contributions to Social Security, unemployment insurance, federal or state withholding taxes, nor provide any other contributions or benefits that might be expected in an employer-employee relationship, unless required by law due to the level of control exerted. Endorser shall be solely responsible and liable for reporting and paying all federal and state income or other taxes applicable to the Endorser’s compensation under this Agreement and MusclePharm will provide Lender with an IRS Form 1099 at the end of each calendar year in which compensation is paid to Lender, except if Endorser is reclassified as an employee. It is further understood and expressly agreed by Endorser that he has no right or authority to incur expenses, obligations or liabilities in the name of or binding on MusclePharm, and he shall not represent to third parties that he has any relationship (e.g., employer-employee or principal-agent) with MusclePharm other than the independent contractor arrangement set forth in this Agreement, unless directed by MusclePharm.
perturbation.explanation: By adding exceptions related to the level of control exerted by MusclePharm, and the possibility of reclassification, the 'independent contractor' status becomes ambiguous. The original text clearly states the endorser is acting as an independent contractor, but the added clauses suggest the possibility of an employer-employee relationship, particularly if MusclePharm dictates how the services are performed. This creates a contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: IRS guidelines for independent contractor vs. employee classification

perturbation.original_text: As used in this Agreement, “Products” shall mean dietary supplements manufactured within the fifty states of the United States of America; provided, however, MusclePharm shall not produce during the Term (and any renewal Term, if any) any diet pills and/or sexual enhancement products; provided, further, that fat burning products, Shred Matrix and Live Shredded products and products that increase testosterone levels currently produced by MusclePharm as of the date hereof shall be part of the definition of Products for the purpose of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: As used in this Agreement, “Products” shall mean dietary supplements, regardless of the jurisdiction of origin, including those not approved by the FDA, manufactured within the fifty states of the United States of America; provided, however, MusclePharm shall not produce during the Term (and any renewal Term, if any) any diet pills and/or sexual enhancement products, unless required by market demand; provided, further, that fat burning products, Shred Matrix and Live Shredded products and products that increase testosterone levels currently produced by MusclePharm as of the date hereof shall be part of the definition of Products for the purpose of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modified definition expands the scope of 'Products' to include those not approved by the FDA and removes the restriction on specific products like diet pills if market conditions dictate otherwise. This directly contradicts FDA regulations regarding the approval and safety of dietary supplements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FD&C Act) regarding FDA approval of dietary supplements

perturbation.original_text: MusclePharm shall be responsible for ensuring that the products are properly designed and manufactured for safe use and shall promptly and fairly address and resolve all consumer complaints and warranty claims. MusclePharm hereby acknowledges that the AS Parties are not competent to determine whether the products are safe for sale and/or distribution to the public at large. Accordingly, the AS Parties’ approval rights relate to aspects of quality and not to a determination of the safety of the products and any approvals given by the AS Parties of the products shall in no way detract from the MusclePharm’s obligations hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: MusclePharm shall endeavor to ensure that the products are designed and manufactured for safe use, to the best of their ability, and shall address and resolve consumer complaints and warranty claims as they see fit. MusclePharm hereby acknowledges that the AS Parties are not competent to determine whether the products are safe for sale and/or distribution to the public at large. Accordingly, the AS Parties’ approval rights relate to aspects of quality and not to a determination of the safety of the products; any safety issues will ultimately be decided by MusclePharm, and any approvals given by the AS Parties of the products shall in no way detract from the MusclePharm’s limited obligations hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall be responsible' to 'shall endeavor to ensure', the obligation for product safety is weakened. The addition of 'to the best of their ability' introduces subjectivity and makes enforcement difficult. The original text implies a strict obligation, while the modification suggests a more lenient approach, conflicting with consumer protection laws requiring manufacturers to ensure product safety. Furthermore the addition of 'as they see fit' gives MusclePharm complete discretion regarding consumer complaints.
